english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verses 8-9): When the disbelievers said "Why has not an angel been sent down to him?" They meant an angel in the form of a human. Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: "If We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided." This means the Hour would have been established. "And if We had made him an angel, We would have made him a man." This means We would have made him in the form of a human, that is, in the creation of a human.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Shayban al-Attar

narrators.name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd ibn Hakim ibn Ibrahim ibn Qudamah ibn Mahan al-Saji

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Najih
narrators.alternative_names: Abdullah ibn Abi Najih, Shafi' ibn Mataa

narrators.name: Mujahid
narrators.alternative_names: Abu al-Hajjaj al-Makki, Mujahid ibn Jabr

chainIssues: Ibrahim al-Saji is a known mudallis (Category 3) and uses direct transmission terms which mitigates the tadlis issue. Warqaa' and Ibn Abi Najih report from Mujahid using 'an (عن) which is acceptable for these reliable narrators.

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim al-Saji (ibn Fahd) is a mudallis (Category 3 per Ibn Hajar classification)
potential_issues.impact: However, he is generally considered reliable and uses direct transmission terms (ثنا), which indicates explicit hearing and is accepted even from mudallisun of this category

potential_issues.issue: Use of 'an (عن) transmission term by Warqaa' and Ibn Abi Najih
potential_issues.impact: Minimal impact as both are reliable narrators without known tadlis, and the chain is otherwise strong

Topics: Explanation of why an angel was not sent instead of the Prophet ﷺ
Divine wisdom in sending the Prophet ﷺ as a human

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 19): Muhammad ﷺ was commanded to ask Quraysh: "What is the greatest testimony?" Then he was commanded to inform them saying: "Allah is the witness between me and you."

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Shayban al-Attar

chainIssues: Ibrahim al-Saji is a known mudallis (Category 3) but uses direct transmission terms (ثنا) which is acceptable. Chain is otherwise consistent with reliable narrators.

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim al-Saji (ibn Fahd) is a mudallis (Category 3)
potential_issues.impact: His use of direct transmission terms (ثنا) indicates explicit hearing, which is accepted even from mudallisun

Topics: The testimony of Allah regarding the Prophet's ﷺ message

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 19): "And this Quran has been revealed to me that I may warn you by it and whomever it reaches." This means whoever the Quran reaches from among the Arabs and others.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Shayban al-Attar

narrators.name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd

narrators.name: Mujahid
narrators.alternative_names: Abu al-Hajjaj al-Makki, Mujahid ibn Jabr

chainIssues: Chain is consistent with Hadith 1321 and 1322, with the same issues regarding Ibrahim al-Saji's tadlis but using direct transmission terms.

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim al-Saji (ibn Fahd) is a Category 3 mudallis
potential_issues.impact: Uses direct transmission terms (ثنا), which is accepted for mudallisun of this category

Topics: The universality of the Quran's warning to all people

english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad ibn Ka'b al-Qurazi (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 19): "Whoever the Quran reaches, it is as if Muhammad ﷺ himself reached him."

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Shayban al-Attar

narrators.name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd ibn Hakim ibn Ibrahim ibn Qudamah ibn Mahan al-Saji

narrators.name: Abu Ma'shar
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Abd al-Hasan Abu Ma'shar al-Bahrani

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Ka'b al-Qurazi
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Ka'b ibn Sulaym al-Qurazi
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Hamza al-Qurazi, Muhammad ibn Ka'b

chainIssues: Hadith is mursal (missing direct chain to Prophet) as it ends with Muhammad ibn Ka'b al-Qurazi. Abu Ma'shar is a weak narrator (Da'if) which affects the reliability of this chain. Ibrahim al-Saji is also a mudallis (Category 3) using direct transmission terms.

potential_issues.issue: Abu Ma'shar al-Bahrani is classified as Da'if (weak)
potential_issues.impact: This significantly affects the reliability of the hadith chain, as a weak narrator appears in the middle of the isnad

potential_issues.issue: Hadith is mursal (missing the connection to the Prophet ﷺ)
potential_issues.impact: The chain ends at Muhammad ibn Ka'b al-Qurazi without attribution to the Prophet ﷺ, making this a mursal hadith

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim al-Saji is a Category 3 mudallis
potential_issues.impact: Uses direct transmission term (نا) which indicates explicit hearing

Topics: The effect of the Quran reaching people

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the verse "And they swear by Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists." He said: This is the speech of the polytheists when they saw that every person came out of the Fire except the people of polytheism, and they saw that sins are forgiven but polytheism is not forgiven, nor for any polytheist. So they said: "By Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists." Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: "See how they lie against themselves." This means Allah refutes them.

potential_issues.impact: Uses direct transmission term (ثنا), which is accepted even from mudallisun of this category

Topics: The false oaths of polytheists on the Day of Judgment
The testimony of Allah against the polytheists

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 25): "And among them are those who listen to you." This means the people of Quraysh.

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn uses 'ana (أنا) transmission term which is unusual and indicates uncertainty. This is different from other hadiths. Ibrahim al-Saji remains a Category 3 mudallis using direct transmission terms.

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn uses 'ana (أنا) transmission term
potential_issues.impact: This unusual transmission term introduces ambiguity, though the rest of the chain is reliable

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim al-Saji (ibn Fahd) is a Category 3 mudallis
potential_issues.impact: Uses direct transmission term (نا), which is accepted for mudallisun of this category

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 26): "And they prevent from it (the Quran) and they keep away from it." This means Quraysh prevents from the remembrance of Allah and they keep away from it (the Quran).

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim al-Saji (ibn Fahd) is a mudallis (Category 3)
potential_issues.impact: Uses direct transmission terms (ثنا), which is accepted even from mudallisun of this category

Topics: Quraysh's prevention from the Quran and the remembrance of Allah

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 36): "Only those who hear the remembrance will respond." This means the believers who hear the remembrance respond to it. "And the dead will be raised by Allah." This means the disbelievers will be raised by Allah along with the dead, that is, together with the disbelievers.

Resurrection of disbelievers with the dead

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 44): "We opened for them the gates of everything." This means the ease of worldly life and its comforts upon the earlier generations.

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 47): "Tell me, if the punishment of Allah comes to you suddenly or openly - is it not the wrongdoers who will be destroyed?" This means suddenly while they are secure, or openly while they are watching.

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid (regarding the interpretation of Surah al-An'am verse 50): "Say: Is the blind equal to the one who sees?" This means the one who is astray. "And the one who sees." This means the one who is guided.
